Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

German

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • Wachsthum (superseded)

Etymology

[edit]

From Middle High German wahstuom, ultimately from Proto-Germanic *wahstmaz (“growth”). By surface analysis, wachsen +‎ -tum. Cognate with Old English wæstm (“growth, increase, produce, fruit”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈvakstuːm/
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: Wachs‧tum

Noun

[edit]

Wachstum n (strong, genitive Wachstumes or Wachstums, no plural)

  1. growth

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Wachstum [sg-only, neuter, strong]
singular
indef. def. noun
nominative ein das Wachstum
genitive eines des Wachstumes, Wachstums
dative einem dem Wachstum, Wachstume1
accusative ein das Wachstum

1Now rare, see notes.
